lead_paragraph: Those who started health food and natural product stores in the 1970s and ’80s often face the transition problems found in many family businesses.

headline.print_headline: Natural Product Retailers Make Way for the Next Generation
headline.main: Health Food Retailers Make Way for the Next Generation

snippet: Those who started health food and natural product stores in the 1970s and ’80s often face the transition problems found in many family businesses.
abstract: Estimated 5,000 independent natural products retailers are headed by former activists and health food pioneers now reaching retirement age and facing decision on whether to close, sell to strangers, or turn business over to their children; familial business transitions can be difficult and complicated, and experts say taking the time to get outside advice in planning the turnover can be critical to to ensuring stable second-generation ownership.
